Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy- Major Electrical Flaw
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: This is a great product idea. The picture is very clear and has a wide angle. Unfortunately  like another reviewer stated the product eats batteries constantly whether you use it or not. This is a major electrical flaw. The screen illuminates for ~ 3 seconds.  I probably use 2-3 times a week, so ~ 9 seconds. You constantly have to change batteries constantly which is ridiculous The batteries should easily last for a year . To add insult you have to unscrew very small screws and take off the whole product to do so which is a pain. When you go to their website they have no customer service number or contact number.. I should have seen this before; I would have never bought it. Amazon only gives you 30 days. I am basically out $100I would like to warn others.

Reviews.Title: Decent picture but installation instructions flawed
Reviews.Author: A. Neilll
Reviews.Content: The Cannon Peephole viewer is a nifty device.  It delivers a fairly clear picture of the other side of your door, without having to open it, delivering it to a small digital screen that you mount on the inside of your door.=-=-=- Advantages over a regular peephole  =-=-=-=Basically, it shows you what you would see through a peephole on the small screen; but this has several advantages1) More than one person can look at the Cannon viewer at once, so you can compare notes on who it might be or if you should let them in2) If the person at the door is suspicious, you can easily use your phone cam to take a picture of the image on the screen for use later, if needed3) More comfortable to watch for an extended period4) A reverse peephole viewer is useless against this device.5) Easier for kids than looking through a peepholeWhat would make this a really killer device would be if it has ability to interface with other devices, for example, if I could look out my peephole when I am down in the basement. Also, nightvision would be an excellent addition. But this device wasn't designed for that and I don't subtract anything for those .However, the picture quality on the viewer I got is a bit grainy, perhaps it is because I have mostly used it in lower light with just a porch light.=-=-=-=  Installation =-=-=-=As far as installation, it took me about 30 minutes.  I suspect it could have gone faster, but for some deficiencies in the documentation.  Perhaps it was just me, but it wasn't that clear in the instructions that you had to remove the plate first, and the diagrams and figures didn't show clearly how the viewer attaches to the door.  Again, your mileage may vary, but it seemed like it could have been made clearer with a better diagram.Also, the instructions were absolutely wrong as far as camera orientation.  I had to turn the camera part until the red arrow was pointed nearly 180 degrees in the other direction indicated in the instructions, which means now it is not really that tight in the door.  When I have a few minutes, I will probably take it out and re-seat it.Another issue I had with the instructions is that my door was a little thicker, so the plate would not properly align to the back of the camera piece until I started to screw on the base. That just made me a little confused on if perhaps had the alignment of the door plate incorrect, since the figure showing how the plate attaches to the door is not that great to begin with.Still I am pleased with the device.  Already I have been able to use the device to show someone at the door to my kids.  So while I have kept my old peephole just in case, I think the Cannon Peephole Viewer is a definite keeper.

Reviews.Title: Batteries died
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Installed a month ago then went on vacation for 3 weeks. When we came back the batteries were COMPLETELY DEAD! So we only used it for 1 week and then only 5 to 10 times to test and show people. Picture is good, but 4 batteries every 1 to 2 weeks is bad. Not only that replacing the batteries is really awkward. Two tiny scewrs under the unit that are deeply sunk so it is hard to get them out and the fall onto the floor - tiny tiny screws. Very poor design for replacing batteries. And too heavy user of batteries. BAD. I DO NOT reccomend.

Reviews.Title: Works as Advertised
Reviews.Author: E. J Tastad "ejt"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Very easy to install (drill a hole)Nice sized displayNice looking (iPod styling)Easy to use, single buttonCons:Not configurable, video stays for a few seconds and goes away.Bottom Line: Works as advertised, is a nice easy to install video peephole, with acceptable video quality.  Only you can decide if the price is worth the extra over a traditional optical only unit.This will provide a larger easier to identify image of the people outside, where the optical unit is much cheaper and doesn't have batteries. From the outside it might not be immediately obvious that it is digital vs optical only.I would recommend using non rechargeable lithium AA cells if you have them as they don't have age related issues (they aren't going to leak when they get low) and work better over temperature extremes.

} } } Length:: 0:17 MinsThis is a terrific product if you are concerned about visibility outside your door. It installed easily, about 10 minutes if you already have a peephole. If you don't have an existing peephole, you'll need to drill a hole in your door to install this.Once I removed our current peephole, I put the camera through the existing hole and the mounting plate of the video display. As a install note - do not remove the screen protector over the camera eye until you are done installing. It has an arrow to show which way is up for the camera device.The camera fits in the peephole and the video display plate with a screw back that keeps them both in place. There are additional screws included if you want to mount it more securely but it wasn't necessary for us and since we have a metal door, I didn't want to drill into it anymore than necessary. Batteries are included and replacing the batteries is as simple as removing two screws that secure the mount plate at the bottom of the screen.The picture quality is fine, much better than our original peephole. Our front door is always in shadow but this shows clearly enough and appropriately for the light quality. The panoramic view of the background is good for getting the 'big picture' of what is going on outside. Your guest can look pretty close to the camera and still provide a clear picture.In defense of the product, my video does not show the full quality of the image that actually displays. It is more natural in coloring (the video is a little bluish) and the shadows have more detail in real life.I've had a security camera with a display before but it required too much installation and drilling through walls so I was hesitant to use it. This is a piece of cake and a great way to get that security camera view without a lot of installation. It will not record anything though so if you are looking for a higher end security device for more complete monitoring, this is not it.The display turns off after 10 seconds but a simple push and it comes back on instantly.The specs say that it is good for a door 1.57" to 2.76" (40mm-70mm) and the barrel diameter for the camera is 9/16" to 27/32" (14mm-22mm).

Reviews.Title: So Much Better Than A Peephole
Reviews.Author: Tara M. Lohse "wyrdsister"
Reviews.Content: We installed ours a couple of months ago. It is so much better than a peephole. When I looked through our old peephole the image was distorted, especially since I wear glasses, which made my peephole useless. With our digital door viewer I have a wide and clear view of who or what is at our door. Which I like.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery life
Reviews.Author: Ray Pierre
Reviews.Content: The view of the well lit hall outside my condo is bright and relatively sharp. Based on the image alone I would have probably given this device 4 stars. However, the battery life is unacceptable. In the four months I have had the viewer I needed to replace the batteries four times. With proper design the viewer should draw near zero current, accept when active after pushing the button. In addition there is no Low Battery indicator. You don't find out it is low, or dead, until you push the button and the power light just flickers or fails to light. As mentioned before the batteries are extremely difficult to change (considering they last for such a short period of time). If I could still return the viewer I would return the viewer.

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries too fast!
Reviews.Author: C. Riverso
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this to anyone. This gadget was relatively easy to install and works as intended but goes thru a set of batteries every month! the batteries are not so easy to install. i think i am going to return it for a conventional viewer.

Reviews.Title: Great Alternative to Traditional Peephole
Reviews.Author: Altar Boy "Pax Vobis"
Reviews.Content: The Cannon Security Products DDV-S-01 LCD Peephole Door Viewer is a great device if you have the need to screen who is at your front door before you open it.  I got mine and followed assembly instructions (including the requirement to push in the camera plug all the way before turning it on).  I had to make only a small adjustment in order to get the metal bracket below the frame of the skylight that is 2 inches above my peephole hole in the door.  Since I have some handyman experience the installation was a breeze.  I turned the unit on and behold the front porch and walkway were seen in full color.  The LCD monitor on the inside of the door is very clear, crisp and displays accurate colors unlike many cameras I also have around the house for security.  To use the unit you approach the door and merely push in the "on" button.  The screen stays lit for approximately 4 seconds - long enough to see who is outside.  If you need more time you can always press the button again.The unit seems to be sturdy in construction.  Instructions are very brief but adequate for assembly and installation.  A warning sheet also accompanies the instructions to remind you the importance of pluging in the camera completely before use otherwise you can damage the circuitry of the unit.  The only reason I did not give the DDV-S-01 5 stars is that the peephole camera unit came to me with a cracked front glass on the exterior peephole.  Perhaps someone at the company dropped the unit before packaging it and cracked the glass.  Hopefully I can have it replaced because exposure to outside humidity will ruin most digital camera chips that are exposed to humidity over time.Absent this one defect the Cannon Security Products DDV-S-01 LCD Peephole Door Viewer is one great security product![UPDATE] I contacted the company and they sent me overnight a replacement glass for the exterior peep hole.  That is incredible service and means a lot to me as a consumer.  The company's service department was very accessible and helpful.  This is what you want when you invest in an electronic device.  Because of good service and backing up their product I have changed my rating to 5 stars.  I noticed that in an earlier review of this product by another consumer that the company also offered them a replacement of the product even though the breakage of the product was the obvious fault of the other reviewer.  That review should be changed by that reviewer if the company makes good on their promise to replace the product in fairness to the seller.  And hopefully this time he or she will follow instructions when assembling and installing the unit. :  I think this is a great product and well worth considering for door security.

Reviews.Title: The whole family can see who's at the door
Reviews.Author: Big Al "Alan Rivière"
Reviews.Content: To install this Cannon Peephole Door Viewer, the hardest part is to drill a hole through the door; the rest is quite easy.  You need a power drill and a 9/16" drill bit and you should be able to drill the hole straight through the door, not at an angle.  Metal doors may present additional challenge.  The camera unit will fit doors from 1.57" to 2.76" thick.  Once the hole is drilled, installing this peephole door viewer is a breeze.Generally, this is what you do: Undo the two small bolts at the bottom of the LCD unit and remove the metal mounting plate at the back.  That exposed the battery compartment and the camera mini-plug socket.  Install the 4 AA batteries included.  Unscrew the locking barrel of the camera unit.  Insert the camera from the outside through the door and the center hole of the mounting plate, making sure that the lens is facing outward and the red arrow on the protective film on the lens is pointing up.  Orient the mounting plate such that the white gasket is against the door and the "UP arrow" is pointing up.  Screw on the locking barrel of the camera unit to secure the camera and mounting plate on the door.  There are three screw holes on the mounting plate for additional screws (included) to hold the plate securely on the door.  Insert the mini-plug of the camera into the socket of the LCD unit.  There is a warning message attached to it regarding the right way and the wrong way to insert the mini-plug.  It is important that you push the mini-plug all the way into the socket. Failure to do so may short out the camera, according to a spokesman of the seller.  Secure the LCD unit onto the mounting plate with the two locking bolts and the peephole door viewer is operational.Push the ON-OFF button on the viewer and LCD screen displays a picture for 10 seconds.  Contrary to the old style peep-glass, the whole family can see who is at the door at the same time with this Cannon Peephole Door Viewer.  Height differences among family members no longer matter; even a small child can use the viewer as long as he can reach the ON-OFF button.  These are important considerations.  Furthermore, even among adults, it is a more elegant way to peep by observing an LCD screen than pressing an eye against a peep-glass and a cheek flat against the door.  The quality of the picture is acceptable in full daylight but becomes grainy in a low light situation.  I have a problem with the duration of the picture.  It is too short.  If a stranger is at the door and I do not wish to talk to him, I would like to stay quietly behind the door and watch him leave.  Ten seconds is just too short for that.  I wish that the button is set up in a way that I can choose 10, 30, or 60 second duration.  Nevertheless, this Cannon Peephole Door Viewer is a neat security product worthy of consideration.

Reviews.Title: Great gadget for improved security
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We received the Cannon DDV-S-01 LDC peephole Viewer a few weeks ago and have been using it for approximately one month. The device is small and attractively styled.Since we did not have a previous peephole in the door, installing it ran us into the problem of not having the correct drill bit. Off to the store to buy the right one, and, after some fiddling, the viewer was installed, a little off center, but viewable for each member of the family.The image is very clear, and the best part for us is that the kids (one is 11 and one is 5) can see who is at the door before they open it.Of course, they love using it, and can't wait for the doorbell to ring. I think it's great that they no longer blindly open the door. They have been  able to see whoever is on the other side, and the field of view is quite large.It is a fun, very usable gadget, which definitely helps to improve our safety.

Reviews.Title: Devours batteries, even while sleeping
Reviews.Author: NOCHalfJap
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for six months or so now.  The product itself is as advertised.  Great low-light resolution, terrific viewing angle, things in the distance are fairly clear, etc.The one fatal flaw that this product has is that it chews through batteries at a ridiculous rate.  This has been true since the day I installed it, but I thought maybe I was just using it more than average.Recently I decided to test this.  I changed batteries one month ago to the day.  I installed regular Duracel AAs--not the fancy 'optimized for digital devices' ones, not the 'guaranteed to last longer than any other battery ones', just regular Duracel AAs.  I verified the batteries were fully charged (they're brand new) and the unit was working.  I then refrained from touching the viewer for one month.  This morning I pushed the button on the front to activate the view screen, and...nothing.  Removed batteries, tested them, they're dead.31 days, I haven't even activated the device, and it ate four (4) AA batteries.  This is consistent with my experiences during the entire time I've owned this device.  I wondered if there was something wrong with the unit I received, but many other reviews have stated that it goes through batteries quickly.  I wish I'd read a review that explained just how quickly it went through them, even when it's not doing anything.  Could have saved myself $100.  Now looking for a replacement unit.Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Crummy door camara
Reviews.Author: dde123
Reviews.Content: Works well but constantly uses the batteries. They wear out in a short time. I have never been able to use the thing to verify who is at the door because the batteries were dead. Recommend using a peephole instead.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT.
Reviews.Author: sneeziegirl
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this four stars instead of five because I followed the directions in lining up the arrow on the lens straight up, but I still had to twist the lens in order for the picture to show right side up.  Very easy to install.  Please note that the adhesive strip is not the only way this will stay up.  The back of the lens is held in the door by a screw-on bolt that attaches through the plate an onto the back on the lens.  This will hold the plate firmly to the door and you don't have to worry about the viewer coming off when you slam the door.  It took me more time to vacuum up the styrofoam filling from my door than it did to install this.  But i read the directions and most importantly, I watched the video provided above next to all the pictures.  I can see clear over to my neighbors house across the street.  It has a very clear, wide angle view.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: I See You
Reviews.Author: Darryl Owens
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement of a cheaper model. Installation was a breeze as I already had the hole drilled. I had to filed the hole a little but that could have been from a  slightly crooked hole in a matel door. The image is superb and clear. Night viewing is grayscale but clear enough to know who's at your door. My porch light is a  standard 60 watts on a sensor that dims after  a while. I could see clear without the light in the bright mode.I have a glass top storm/screen door in front of the normal door but still see clearly.My wife and daughter love this item and can clearly see who is at the door.  I am at ease when not home. Not sure how long the batterries will last.

Reviews.Title: This thing is awesome
Reviews.Author: Howard Brown
Reviews.Content: I just installed mine tonight and we love it. It's amazing. It was easy to install and you are able to rotate the front to make it perfectly level. I highly recommend getting one because you can see who is at your door clear as can be.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Security Peephole
Reviews.Author: GD
Reviews.Content: I have the exact problem as so many others. I spent $99 for a product that goes through batteries every two weeks with my using the viewer 2-3 times at most. It is ridiculous. I bought this thing the end of May 2012 and it is now August and have gone through 4 sets of batteries. I'm going to take it out and dump it and I don't recommend this to anyone unless they get this power problem corrected. It's a lot of money and the premise is great--but the cost of batteries and the little screws you have to take out every time to replace them makes it soooo not worth it. If I could get my money back I would. I wouldn't give it even 1 star.  Cannon Security Products DDV-S-01 LCD Peephole Door Viewer, Brushed Silver

Reviews.Title: Good idea - badly implemented
Reviews.Author: R. A Gibson
Reviews.Content: I have gone through 2 already.  First was Dead on Arrival.  The second took 5 MONTHS to be shipped from Cannon (very unfriendly support ) and lasted about 6 weeks before biting the dust.  Conclusion: assuming these things are ready for prime time, CANNON is most decidedly Not the vendor of choice.  This is Not a quality product.  Best advised to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: So very disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Travellady "Travellady"
Reviews.Content: I bought this product and absolutely loved it.  Based on my purchase my sister also bought the product.I am so disappointed with it now.  We rarely use the front door so most coming to the door are strangers.  Unfortunately more often than not when I try to use the product the batteries are dead.  The batteries don't seem to last even a month and it is difficult to change the batteries.  It takes a small screw on the bottom is difficult to reach.  My sister has the very same problem.This product should not eat batteries.  I now can't see outside to identify the caller.I'd love to just return it, but I'd love it more if it worked as promised.

Reviews.Title: Good customer service
Reviews.Author: Roger S. Uehara "Torrance Trojan"
Reviews.Content: The first one I got didn't work.  Amazon makes it so easy to either get your money back or exchange it for another.  I exchanged it for another.  The original one I got was in a plain white box.  The second one came in a box that had pictures of the product on it.  Anyway the new one works like a charm.  It really gives you a much bigger and brighter view that the old peephole I had.  It installed easily.  I highly recommend this.Second Review - November 27, 2012 -  The second one I received eats batteries like crazy.  It seems like after a couple of weeks with no actual use, I had to replace the batteries.  This happened on several occasions.  I do not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Peep hole poops out
Reviews.Author: Ernest D. Pearson
Reviews.Content: The whole think looks great beautiful clear picture great field of vision.Now for the cons. Uses batteries and is always dead after a few days weather you use it or not. To change the batteries you have to find a little cross head screw driver to remove the cover Oh did I mention the screws are not easy to get to once the unit is installed.I don't think this was a good purchase

Reviews.Title: Super geek gadget - with real benefits
Reviews.Author: Peter B. Nelson
Reviews.Content: Review for Cannon DDV-S-01 Peephole Door ViewerPros:Solid ConstructionQuick-to-DisplayClean FinishAdds SecurityGood Image QualityCons:Vertical Mount Option not perfectI should preface this review by stating I am a bit of a "gadget guy" - add a switch or flashy light and I'm almost bound to love it.  A device like the Cannon DDV-S-01 Peephole viewer is right up my alley for preferred devices.  Why have a simple pee hole when you can have a camera attached LCD viewer?!Gadgetry aside, the DDV-S-01 provides a real security function that is far better than a simple peep hole for 2 significant reasons.1)  It's provides a superior view for all.  I have young children who cannot reach a regular peep hole - they can use this easily.  Even for someone of regular peep hole viewing height, the view is far superior in detail and image.2)  It cannot be reversed.  A regular peep hole is just an optical bubble lenses - people can look though it into your house if they use a $70 "Tactical Door viewer Peephole Reverser".  Google it if you don't believe me, then Google Erin Andrews.The actual device itself is comprised of two parts.  A peep hole camera and an electronic viewer.  The camera assembly is very solid and well made.  Heavy for its size, like an expensive camera.  The viewer is plastic, but has a simple elegance.  Installation was a breeze.  I had to drill a 1/2" hole in my door, as I did not have a peep hole previously installed.  Then it was simply inserting the camera through door and thin mounting plate for viewer and screwing the long nut - quite long to accommodate thicker doors.  After that, plug in viewer, hang on mounting plate, and screw in two retaining screws.  If I hadn't had to drill the hole; I would have had this done in less than 5 minutes.  The bolt holds the mounting plate quite securely and the adhesive tape prevents rotation - I see no reason to mar the door with extra, optional screws.Using the electronic viewer is simple: just press the button.  Image comes on screen in about 1/2 a second and stays on for approximately 12 seconds.  Image is clear and works well even in low light situations.It's too wide for my door.  I have a standard 36" wide 6 panel entry door.  The center tenon is 4.5 inches wide.  The Cannon DDV is just over 5.5 inches wide.  So, the DDV hangs out half an inch on either side.. over part of the panels.  Looks bad.  Initially I was a bit miffed - thinking there was no vertical mount option.  Then I watched the Canon install video again.Fortunately, there is an option to mount vertical.  But there are two minor annoyances about this.  First, the button and logo are sideways - this is less an issue for button, but logo looks dumb sideways.  Second, in order to hide the mount holes, I need to have power button on the top.  Minor, I know, but I would prefer to have power at bottom as it is easier to reach for little ones.  These are minor annoyances to an otherwise solid product, but will keep it from 5 stars.Note Bene: there is a photo showing horizontal mount near top of door.  That seems unrealistic as a viewer, when horizontal, does not have good vertical reach - you'd see only the tops of shorter persons heads.  It really does need to be mounted lower than that, at normal peep height.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: N2styx
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical at first. But this is WAY cool.  It was very easy to install. (I unscrewed the old eye piece and screwed this eye piece in. - Easy Peasy). The screen is crisp and in color.  It sees really good at night.  No negatives at all.  Sturdy quality construction.  I have no idea of battery life yet, but so far, so good!!

Reviews.Title: Nice, convenient, and great for kids
Reviews.Author: Joshua Senecal
Reviews.Content: We've used this for a little while now, and really like it. It's more convenient than looking through the peephole, and the viewer has a nice simple design that goes with almost anything. The front evokes the iPod Touch or iPhone: black, LCD screen, one button. It's simple. To be honest, while it's nice not having to look through the peephole with the fisheye lens, as an adult it wasn't that big a deal. To my mind, where this product shines is it makes it much easier for my kids (who aren't tall enough to see through the peephole) to easily see who is at the front door. All they have to do is reach up, push the button, then step back and see who is on the display. They love it.The display is bright and easy to see. The image quality is very good. The camera delivers a nice picture as well--I was surprised at how nice it was. In lower-light situations the picture gets grainy as expected, but is still decent. With a porch light at night it's perfectly fine.This is very easy to mount under normal circumstances, and should only take a few minutes with nothing more than a screwdriver. Unfortunately, the design assumes you have several inches of flat door around your peephole. If you don't, the viewer will not be flush against the door, and can't be installed. This was our situation. To remedy it I had to make a spacer out of some craft wood and drill a hole in it for the camera to go through. I attached the viewer mounting place to the wood, then connected everything. I've included pictures with this review.The product does have a few shortcomings, mostly related to installation. The nut that holds the camera in the door has two flat edges to make tightening easier. The camera body itself is round with no place to grip easily. So when tightening the nut I had difficulty keeping the camera oriented properly, as it was difficult to hold on to. Plus, when looking at the camera it is not obvious which part is "up". It comes with a protective sticker that indicates which side is "up", but once that sticker is removed you've no way of telling. I marked mine for reference. I consider these minor annoyances, but I think they should be addressed.

Reviews.Title: Run do not Walk
Reviews.Author: Alex-Chris 1970, 78412
Reviews.Content: I wish I read the other reviews first.  Yes, batteries run out in days at best.  Wow, what a waste of money.  Plus it's sealed up with an star wrench and you really have to have it on hand to quickly change out batteries.  I started using rechargeable batteries and keeping the charger in an outlet nearby.  I will definitely get rid of this piece of junk as soon as I have a few extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: R. Stabler
Reviews.Content: The first Peephole viewer I bought was faulty so returned it to Amazon without any hassles at all and send me a replacement. This one worked initially for about a week when the batteries went dead so replaced them,and this time they lasted about 2 weeks, the viewer had only been used once during that period.Definitely don't recommend it.I don't really want to go through the ritual of returning it again so it is sitting is on my door, a useless item.Strangely enough the first peephole viewer I bought seems to be working OK so far.

Reviews.Title: Works very well, but be careful if you have a metal door
Reviews.Author: R. McAdams
Reviews.Content: I got this months ago from the Vine program. The reason I am not posting a review on it until now, is because I had to wait until I could get someone to come out and professionally install it.  We have a metal door, and the hole in it for the peephole was just a little bit too narrow for the camera peephole of this device.  If you have a wooden door, you can just kind of worry the hole wider with a screwdriver, or whatever else you have handy to chisel the wood. But, with a metal door, (if you are careful, like me) you are going to want to have someone come out and professionally install the unit.Once it is installed, though, it is fantastic.  The camera standing in for the peephole eliminates the tell-tale darkening that can be seen outside the door, when the peephole is looked through, which broadcasts that someone is behind the door.  The camera also gives much more detail and a wider field of view than a standard peephole.  Our front landing is well lit, so the camera works well at night as well, so I couldn't tell you how well it works in low lighting, but I would imagine not very well, if most digital cameras I have used are any indicator.The mount for the unit is solid, and the simple cable hookup is easy to deal with, and makes battery replacement a snap.  I really love this unit, and will be taking it with us on our next move, or upgrading to the newest version if there is one.4 stars.

Reviews.Title: See Your Way to a Safer Home
Reviews.Author: Bryan Carey "Bryan Carey"
Reviews.Content: It is always better to be safe than sorry, and the Cannon Peephole viewer is a good device for keeping your home safe. It lets you clearly see who is on the other side of your door without having to open the door or strain to see through the tiny peephole.The way this peephole works is simple enough. You can install it in about 20 minutes and it attaches itself directly to your front door with the picture- taking lens pointed directly toward the outside. The device is now set and ready to use, providing protection around the clock. You will be able to quickly see, even from a distance, who is at the front door and because of the way it is installed, it protects against the use of a reverse peephole viewer.Kids are often the ones at greatest risk of opening the front door to a stranger and this is yet another nice quality of a product like this. Young children are far too short to look through a peephole viewer, but they will not need to if the Cannon peephole viewer is installed. All they will need to do is look up, at the viewer, and they will clearly see who is knocking on the door. This gives me much greater peace of mind, because I know from experience that my kids are far too prone to just open the door upon hearing a knock. Now, they know to look at the peephole viewer first.The image projected on the screen of this device isn't gigantic, but it is large enough and while not crystal clear, it is clear enough to tell who is on the other side. I agree with other reviewers who have said that this device could be improved if it included some type of interface that would transmit the image so that it could be seen in another part of the house. If it could do this, you could be, say, upstairs in your house and see who is knocking on the door. Perhaps a future version will include an enhancement like this.Safety is important and a device like the Cannon Peephole viewer is a nice addition to any home. It makes it easy to see who is knocking or ringing the doorbell and it makes a good choice for those with children and others who prefer to play it safe.

Reviews.Title: I really like this peephole viewer! Great for seniors!
Reviews.Author: Get What We Give
Reviews.Content: For people who don't have windows at their door or even for those who do, but don't want to let those on the outside know they are looking....this is awesome!It's a relatively simple install and voila! you've got an easily viewable peephole.With this thing you don't have to worry about outsiders seeing your shadow pass across the peephole, because all you have to do is press a button and from a comfortable distance, view whoever is outside.The screen is about as large as an iPhone screen and it has a very clear image (the brightness of the image depends on the brightness of your doorstep).This is a great idea for seniors or women who live alone, because they don't have to let anyone know they're at home if they don't want to.Think of all the uninvited guests you can avoid by just pressing a button and never letting them know you're at home!!Awesome!My only quibble is that the case for the viewer isn't metal, it's plastic.

Reviews.Title: zero stars...works great but batteries die so fast when you use it they're DEAD
Reviews.Author: tom s
Reviews.Content: the batteries don't last a week in AZ weather.....I assume that may be the problem but for a product not to work for very long should be addressed in development of recall all those peices of junk.....i threw my unit in the trash where it belongs....

Reviews.Title: Battey eater
Reviews.Author: Ashok
Reviews.Content: This battery eater. When you may need most theere may not any power. I have to keep checking all the time to make sure its working, Never ever buy this.

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: Dave D
Reviews.Content: At first the unit was burning through batteries at lightening speed and then in only 4 months after purchase the screen failed entirely. What a waist of money !!

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, but eats batteries.
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: The batteries keep dying in this camera. I mounted this in a steel door, and tried to insulate it as best I could, but a fresh set of batteries only last about 2 - 3 weeks. I switched to rechargables because of this, and have to keep swapping them out.The picture quality is excellent for a peephole camera. The view is wide and clear. Nightime view with a door side light, is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Works but battery issues
Reviews.Author: KG
Reviews.Content: Like others have mentioned, the battery life really sucks. They go dead every couple of weeks it seems. Just seems to get shorter and shorter battery life over time. So much that I've stopped putting batteries in for a few months to look for an alternative solution.

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries
Reviews.Author: cameron dolby
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about six months.  It serves its purpose, but I have to change the batteries at least once per month and I only push the view button about once or twice per day max.  Even when sitting idle, it still uses batteries.  This is a design flaw.

Reviews.Title: Avoid this product!
Reviews.Author: Rebus
Reviews.Content: I realize only a year after purchasing this that the product name, "Cannon" led me to think it was the camera company, but a long search on the internet fails to find ANY evidence of who the manufacturer is.Clearly, they're hiding to escape the wrath of people like me, who bought this and discovered, after Amazon's warranty expired, that there is a serious electrical problem that causes batteries to be depleted in about a week. I've tried five different pairs, including super-powered ones, with the same result.Some reviewers seem happy, but notice how many of us there are who feel totally ripped off.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: kat
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to read that many of the users are having battery issues.  We have been using this product for over a year and have not had to change the batteries yet.  Maybe it was a bad batch?We have the type of double-wide steel door [with no screen door] that you cannot see through except if you look through the peephole. This door viewer allows us to clearly see who is at the door instead of struggling to see who is there through the small peephole.  We used to look out the window of the living room to see who was at the door but do not have to do that anymore.I would recommend the product if the battery issue is investigated and fixed.

Reviews.Title: Love the product but...
Reviews.Author: Purz "Purz"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this product, the idea of it, the quality of it, etc.  It was easy to install.  My only problem with this is that it eats batteries far too quickly (at least one set per month - four at a time) and the batteries are not terribly convenient to change.

Reviews.Title: works great!
Reviews.Author: morgan4
Reviews.Content: The screen is very clear, and I like the zoom feature. It has a clear view when it is dusk out too!

Reviews.Title: Really bad on batteries
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: This viewer works as described but it has one major drawback.  It consumes batteries very quickly, whether you use the camera or not.  I've had this viewer for 3 months and I've changed the batteries 3 times already.  Now I barely even use the viewer anymore because I don't want to drain the batteries.  But use it or not, plan on replacing the batteries once a month. Replacing the batteries is also not the easiest thing to do.  You need a tiny screwdriver and you need to make sure you don't lose the screws that are screwed to the bottom of the unit.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Works and looks great. Install was painless. However, the fact that you have to take the thing apart using a small screwdriver to replace the batteries is a major drawback.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Product !
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Knox
Reviews.Content: While watching a DYI channel one night I saw this product being installed and thought WOW that is so cool I wonder if they really work. When Christmas came this year I remembered the digital peephole and thought how great for my 92 year old mother . I ordered the Cannon because of Cannon cameras and the reputation for quality.I was not wrong in the decision. My Mother is thrilled to see with such clarity the entire area outside her home. We feel that she is far safer and the peephole viewer is so simple for her to use.It took less then 5 minutes to replace the old peephole with the Cannon peephole viewer.  Truely the best purchase that I have made in quite a while !!

Reviews.Title: Lots of compliments
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: Very cool technology. Does a great job at wide angle and back-lit so porch light is not necessary. Guests at the house always get a kick out of it and ask where we got it. Definitely worth the money, but be sure to keep rechargeable batteries on hand because it does go through them pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: Front door security
Reviews.Author: MtnHiker
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 80 year old mother that was afraid to use the regular viewing lense.  She kept tissue in the hole so she could not be reverse viewed and also freared being seen looking out.  The view is very good even on her well shadowed porch.  Faces can be seen without being front lit and her front door color is dark too.  Battery life is however on the short side but my mother was able to unscrew the front and change them herself.  It would be better if it was easier to change them though, I think many elderly people will be unable to do it without help. Installation was easy and I only needed to slightly clean up the hole from the small standard size lense hole that was already there.

Reviews.Title: Solid construction, should last awhile!
Reviews.Author: J. Cummings
Reviews.Content: Had this on my door for over a year and it is working great. For under a Hundred it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: I spy
Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: I really like to be able to see who is at the door, my front door is in a cove and hard to see who is knocking from the courthyard windows.  This is a real added advantage.

Reviews.Title: need a TON of batteries
Reviews.Author: Franklin J. Bertelle
Reviews.Content: Batteries aren't cheap. This thing eats them like candy. Other than that, it is just great. 99 dollars for the unit is way too much because of the batteries issue.

Reviews.Title: Works well, though optics and materials could be better
Reviews.Author: Omar Siddique
Reviews.Content: A digital door-viewer that replaces a normal peephole, it works well but is unnecessarily bulky.Optical quality is decent but the product picture must be a stock photo since there was a distinct fish-eye effect to the image (which makes sense for the curved lens).  The wide viewing angle is helpful, but the fake photo is unnecessarily misleading. The viewer has no viewing ability in the dark, but worked fine with the porch lights turned on, as well as in daylight.Installation was simple (fits just like a regular peephole).  Hold the camera in place (the "outside" part), while screwing in the back half (which also holds the mounting bracket in place).  The viewer hooks over the bracket and small screws hold it in place.On the negative, the viewer's materials look a little plastic-y and cheap, especially if you have a nice door.  Using a metal casing, or all one color, or making it less bulky and obtrusive would make it fit into more settings.The viewer timeout (before the screen blanks again) is very short, maybe 2 seconds.  Making this adjustable, or setting at a more reasonable 5 seconds would be more useful.The viewer is also rather large for what it does.  The thickness of the unit is mostly to house the 4 AA batteries and mounting bracket (and some empty space), it really looks like it could be designed to be much thinner, perhaps using button batteries or AAA's.  Modern phones (that also include a camera) have similar or larger screens (with much other electronics) in considerably thinner packages, so this thing is just unnecessarily bulky.The Cannon name as opposed to Canon which makes cameras confused me, but they are apparently unrelated.I haven't tried any other digital door viewers, so I'm not sure how the competition measures up, but for providing some added functionality and security for my mother, it works well so far (I'll update if it fails or eats batteries), but it could certainly be better-made and more physically streamlined.  Recommended with reservations.

Reviews.Title: battery life updated 11-19-13
Reviews.Author: aljar
Reviews.Content: hard to believe that the battery life is so short, installed 7-19-2012 had to replace batterys 7-21-2012 this is a nice unit, but batterys every 3 days is unacceptable, 99.00 unit should be designed to last a bit longer than that!! the camera is great,it gives a much more clear pic of whos at my door, installation is simple.UPDATE  INSTALLED Duracell batterys on 7-21-2012 today is 8-3-2012 and the unit is functioning just fine, so i up the star rating to 4, if it goes a month i will give it 5.UPDATE-- Batteries lasted 1 month, still annoying, because the life goes out whether you use it or not, so on 4-16-2013 i added a switch between the battery box and unit, flip the switch and works just like the button, today 6-12-2013 it is still working fine, so far thats twice as long as normal. loving this thing now! its a 5update 7-10-13 still same batteries 3 mos and still goingupdate 11-19-13,  7 months still working on same batteries

Reviews.Title: not all that
Reviews.Author: livealone
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to install as the needed hole to insert viewer is slighlty larger than regular 'peep hole'. Once in, it will be diffilcut to go down to the regular size peep hole if desired.  When there is a lot of door opening /closing activity, it tends to pop out from the door, just sort of 'hangs out'. Snaps back into the door-holder but seems cheap.  The viewing is 120 degrees so it is much bigger than the regular ones, and it does have some low light improvement in viewing.  It is an improvement over what I had, but it went from a cost of $6. to $100. So the price is putting it into the 'not all that', for the price.  It also seems to be thin plastic, was worried if it fell on the floor will break when installing.

Reviews.Title: lcd peephole
Reviews.Author: GW
Reviews.Content: This is a really cool product.  Directions are easy to follow and installation is easy.  Display is large and the colors are bright

Reviews.Title: Product good but died after 2 months
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: This item is really cool and works great when it worked but it started acting funny after 2 months and now doesn't really work.  That part is not cool.  I am going to try to exchange it for a new one because besides that the item is awesome.  If the replacement works then I would give this item 5 stars.  It truly is something everyone who has a peep hole should have.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected !
Reviews.Author: Jay Gatsby
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this viewer. It took me about 30 mins to install on my front door, including drilling the hole thru the door. The picture is no way HD, but is sharp enough for you to recognize the faces of your visitors. The only complaint that I have are the instructions that came in the box, but if you watch the above video, it's very easy to figure out. My suggestion is to install the batteries and the camera to the viewer first to see if works properly and you are satisfied with the results prior to any drilling of holes thru the door, and at the same time compare the orientation of the camera to the red arrow indicator to see if it's level. Mine was dead on. The last piece of advice is not to overtighten the (2) micro screws that is used to secure the screen to the bracket so it will be easier to remove when batteries need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: Great Security Device
Reviews.Author: kaye Davis
Reviews.Content: This was easy to install and works beautifully. I can see the whole front porch as well as part of the driveway and street. I have not had it long enough to comment on durability or battery life, but so far it works like a charm and I have not had to replace the batteries. With this device, there is no need to open the door without knowing who is on the other side and the view is much better than with a regular keyhole viewer on the door.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME VIEW AND CLARITY!
Reviews.Author: Corinne Sayles "lvhomesayles"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this product to give us a better view of the front entry of our home.  WOW does it work good.  The clarity is awesome!  Only downfall is the batteries it came with ran out quickly.  Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: NO HOME SHOULD BE WITHOUT THIS PEEPHOLE!
Reviews.Author: Michael I. Viets
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very excited to have this peephole in our front door! No more answering the doorbell only to find people we want nothing to do with, or trying to look through a tiny hole with one eye. With this Door Viewer, we can see the whole front porch in living color and on a nice-sized little tv screen. Wonderful!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Greatest Purchase of the Year
Reviews.Author: DMR "unahacker"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Peephole Door Viewer because my eyes are not as young as I am.  This is a great addition to the security system at the house.  Everyone here thinks I made a good choice with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!!!
Reviews.Author: Ian Ross "BigFoot"
Reviews.Content: I just completed the installation of this peephole viewer and am very satisfied.My door was a bit thinner than the specs required, so I went to my local hardware store and bought a flat washer and a lock washer that fit around the barrel.  (I took the barrel with me to ensure a good tight fit.)  I was a bit afraid that extending the barrel into the back of the display unit might produce a problem but there was adequate clearance.I put the flat washer on the outside of the door and the lock washer inside and tightened everything down snug - but not too tight that it might damage the threads.Like a few other reviewers I found that the little red dot on the outside of the fisheye lens was not accurate or aligned properly, but it wasn't a big deal to rotate the lens until the picture was absolutely level.The viewer took eight days to get from Des Plaines, IL to Northern Ontario, which is more than acceptable considering it had to go through Canada Customs.It took me all of ten minutes (not including the trip to the hardware store) to complete the installation as I already had a peephole viewer in my door.Great product!

Reviews.Title: Installation warning - read this one
Reviews.Author: R. C. Matcek
Reviews.Content: Before I mention my slight warning, The nighttime viewing without my exterior wall-mounted front light on is dark.  However, I would still have no issues distinguishing whether the person is non / invited guest.  It works great with the light on, and I have yet to use it during the day, as I just got done with the install.My image stays on for 9 seconds, and yes pressing it during that time while not shut it off like you would imagine.  It takes 4 AA batteries that are included.As another reviewer mentioned, the unit will not look right if used in the vertical orientation because of their logo and the power button "image".  The power button should have been able to be rotated, but in my quick attempt, I could not make it happen.  Also, the power button does not need the "image" on it because there is only ONE button on the whole unit; any guesses what it that ONE button may be for?!?!  The fix to make everybody happy would be for them to construct it with a rotatable power button, and just put their logo on it.  Or better yet, remove the logo entirely, and maybe just flash it on the screen before / after the camera's view is displayed.I used a half inch drill bit, and then had to increase the diameter ever-so-slightly to get it to a true 14mm.  I just used a regular (round) smaller drill bit, to shave out the cut-out.  I just used it by applying even pressure for all 360 degrees, and pushed the drill back and forth in a sawing motion.The "correct side up" red arrow was slightly off in my case.  But easily resolved with repetitive test-fits while plugging in and checking out the display each time.Finally, on to my main installation gripping, which is really more of a manufacturer's issue, but had I known I could have adjusted to resolve it, but maybe now you can pre-resolve it.  I am just assuming this is true for all models, and mine is not a one-off / lemon.  I drilled the hole perfectly centered where my vertical and horizontal stiles come together in the middle of my wooden door.  The panels in between all the stiles are thinner and sculpted / ornamental.  When I put it all together, I glanced at its final resting place, no do-overs, and I hoped what I saw was just my imagination or an illusion (since I mounted it lower than my eye level).The MANUFACTURER did not place the drilled hole in the absolute center of the unit!  WTH!  The final dimensions from the top and bottom of the unit to the adjacent thinner panels are off by an 1/8th of an inch.  I know its not much, but I notice it, and it is in a noticeable place, on a "nice" front entry wood door.  But there is no excuse, they should have centered it; how hard could it be?Well easy fix for you, not me.  And please, carefully measure the unit and verify that yours is not centered as well and is off the same dimensions I mention before proceeding with this simple solution.MARK THE CENTER OF WHERE YOU WANT IT MOUNTED, AND DRILL ONLY 1/16TH OF AN INCH ABOVE IT! WTH!

Reviews.Title: Nice Alternative
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: I was happy to change out the old peep hole on my front door to this item. Easy to install, great for looking before opening your door to strangers. The picture is a little grainy (it's not HD) but I needed the view because there are no windows on this side of my home. I would suggest installing one to anyone and other family members who might need the extra added security!

Reviews.Title: Nice solid product, but picture is not as clear as add makes it.
Reviews.Author: Buyn It
Reviews.Content: It took me 5 minutes to install the product once I gathered my tools.  Easy install.  The product feels solid, not a toy but the picture on the video is not as clear as they make it look on the ad.  The peephole definitely looks like a lens and not a peephole.

Reviews.Title: Advantage of digital technology. Way better than the traditional ancient peepholes
Reviews.Author: Kiyo M.
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Nice display. The camera has a very wide angle view so you'll get a clear view of everything and in color.- The monitor uses 4 AA batteries and they are included!- The camera connects to the monitor via standard 3.5mm jack! This means that if you get a 3.5mm female to male extension cable, you don't necessarily have to have the monitor/camera right attached to the door. I'm using an extension cable over 10 feet (of course you'll have to figure out a way to hide the cable) to extend the monitor and I had no loss of video or signal.- Far better than the traditional peephole; more than one person being able to see who's at the door, clear view.- When battery is low, a light indicator will turn on.Specs:Door thickness: 1.56" to 2.76" (40mm-70mm)Barrel diameter: 9/16" to 27/32" (14mm-22mm)Sensor: 0.3 MP CMOSLCD screen: 3.5" TFTSize: 5.31" width x 3.34" height x 0.96" diameter (135mm x 85mm x 24.5mm)Weight: 12.4 oz (350g)The monitor stays on for only 10 seconds after each button press. (holding it forever will not keep it stay on; it will always turns off after 10 seconds and you'll have to press the button again AFTER it turns off. Let's say you press the view button AGAIN - within the 10 seconds - let's say after 5 seconds, it will not actually reset for an additional 10 seconds of viewing.)In the future, a really cool feature they could add (maybe in a premium verison of this) would be to be able to "screenshot"/take a picture (have an extra button) of what's on the screen/monitor and have a high resolution picture store in a micro SD card. That would be very useful.One concern is how long the batteries will last. I'll see how that goes and also try to upload a video of the product.

Reviews.Title: What a fantastic way to see who's visiting you!
Reviews.Author: Livin' La Vida Low-Carb Man "Jimmy Moore"
Reviews.Content: If you've only had a tiny little peephole for your front door, then this Cannon product will revolutionize the way you answer the door forever. It was pretty easy to set it up if you have a peephole already in place. Maybe not as much for some who would need to drill a hole. The video is clear and crisp...something you'll wish you always had once you get it. And you'll definitely want to get it. Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Cool!
Reviews.Author: E. Braun
Reviews.Content: This thing is such a cool little gadget! and it works remarably well!No more squinting through that tiny peephole. Everyone can see a lot easier with this thing.The only kicker here is installation. If you're an apartment-dweller, you'll have to ask your landlord's permission (and probably for his/her help.) since you have to remove the peephole and put a camera in it's place.If you don't have a peephole, or one that's too small, you're going to have to do some drilling.

Reviews.Title: good quality
Reviews.Author: J.Nguyen
Reviews.Content: the resolution is good. however the len view is toward to the left rather in the middle view of 120degree. it's good enough. When i unpack the box, there is a crack in the piece glass. i dont submit the return because my nephew did make a little crash on the back of locking barrel.

Reviews.Title: Quite Handy
Reviews.Author: S. Walker "Wicked Walker Reviews"
Reviews.Content: This peephole viewer is quite handy.  It attaches to your door in replacement of your existing peephole. Once installed it look tech-y and blends nicely with your door.  The picture is pretty good, but grainy at my door.  It could be because the doorstep is low light for my house, but I can still see the image without any problems.  I like it that I can see them without having to get my eye up to the door.  I am one of those people that will not answer the door if I do not know who you are.

Reviews.Title: Invest in Rechargeable Batteries
Reviews.Author: Timothy Walker
Reviews.Content: Overall I am satisfied with this product, though the installation instructions definitely left something to be desired... wish I hadn't peeled the sticker off the peephole lens before reading them! If you're somewhat handy with tools and prefer the thought of using a digital camera back instead of a dirty telescope to tell pizza guy from home invader, then this is the gadget for you. Just stock up on rechargeables!

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: ChiefP
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a bit skeptical but bought this viewer anyway.  Home break ins are a real threat where we live and my wife is too short to see out the peephole well.  I had to bore the hole from my original hole out just a little to get this to fit.  But once in, it works perfectly!  Even in low light I get a clear view of the area outside the door (a little grainy, but more than acceptable).  You hit the button and the picture comes on for about 5 seconds and then powers off.  I would assume battery life would be great.

Reviews.Title: Neat product, bad shipping
Reviews.Author: A Mother of 2 Kidlets
Reviews.Content: This item in its original packaging was placed inside a large bubble mailer for shipping.  The lens of the camera that goes into the door is cracked, so the images on the screen are distorted.  Huge disappointment as I like the idea of this product.Installation was easy...the camera replaces the current fisheye in the door.  Picture quality is good (except in my case of the cracked lens) I gave it 4 starts because you have to mount the screen to the door and it would be better to have a longer cord so the screen could be mounted to the side of the door.Great item for apartment living.

Reviews.Content: Unfortunelly, this LCD peephole door viewer works for a while and a green tag appears. I can' t solve this problem and it is out of order. It  work  for 24 hr just...

Reviews.Title: Overpriced, Disapointing Viewer
Reviews.Author: Sparky
Reviews.Content: This Peephole door viewer is cheaply made of plastic.  The description says satin nickel, but it's really antique brass color.  It does not work well in low light (night time) unless you've a light right next to the door, which defeats the purpose if you have to turn it on to see who's out there.  Mounting it was easy, but to keep it from shifting you're supposed to use three screws in a triangular configuration on the mounting plate.  If you ever take it down, you'll have three small holes at 3/4 inch intervals around the peephole.  Overall a poor design, overpriced, with limited capability.  If you're thinking about this type of peephole viewer, I'd recommend a different manufacturer all together.

Reviews.Title: Changed my mind on this door viewfinder
Reviews.Author: J. Freeman
Reviews.Content: 1/12- I'm handy but challenged by the tiny screws to hold the cover plate on....and off to replace the batteries. Otherwise it has a great view outside the door. I like it!!12/12- Changed my mind. Uses up batteries in 15-20 uses and the batteries are a pain in the back(literally) to replace. I've gone back to the traditional door viewer.

Reviews.Title: good but expensive
Reviews.Author: mangho
Reviews.Content: Well made with sharp image but without call button or voice communication. For the price it should have these features

Reviews.Title: Really does work
Reviews.Author: Gattaca714
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, works just as advertised.  I have no problem seeing who is at the door regardless if its day or night.  The video quality is good, and everyone who sees it is impressed with it.  Very easy to install, took maybe 5 mins or so.  Don't think twice about ordering this unit.

Reviews.Title: The button doesn't work!
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Riker "Say something about yourself!"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased from Amazon the Cannon Security Products DDV-S-01 LCD Peephole Door Viewer.Installation was quite simple (even though we did not have a prior peephole) and the image on the screen is excellent -- BUT we can only view the image by removing and reinserting one of the batteries in the unit (any one). Pushing the button on the viewer simply does not produce the image.  Bad button??I am having difficulty finding out how to contact Cannon Security Products.  Any suggestions?FEBRUARY 27th UP-DATE.  Amazon (great company) is sending me a replacement unit to arrive in two days.  If the replacement unit works, my rating of this Video Peephole Viewer goes up to FIVE STARS.

Reviews.Title: The Camera is not working
Reviews.Author: Laura Limonta
Reviews.Content: When I installed the product I realized that the camera was not working.Maybe we can only change the camera, because the LCD screen is apparently working properly.

Reviews.Title: Mixed Feelings
Reviews.Author: EgusHdus
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting product, and suitable for some, not all, applications.  Depending on the door, the exterior lighting and your location, this can be a blessing.The screen starts off being fairly good sized, and reasonably bright.  The push-to-view function saves battery live (uses 4 AA) and gives a much larger view than a simple door viewer can offer.  Exterior lighting can impact the view, thus a brightly lit reception area will provide the best imagery.Mounting the unit depends on a hole in the door.  If there's an existing hole, it can be enlarged as necessary, but might be high for shorter family members.  Drilling a new hole in a virgin installation should require a bit of forethought on the height off the floor.  In any event, it's a good practice to encourage all family members to learn how to use the unit, for general safety.All in all, a bit pricy, but what price safety and peace of mind?

Reviews.Title: dead upon arrival
Reviews.Author: Wei Jiang "vivian"
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 hours to install this piece of junk. No picture showing up in the LCD. Replaced the batteries, but still, no pictures. Can only see a green bar on the top of the screen. What is wrong with Amazon recently? Used to be pretty happy with most of the online purchases. The recent few orders all turned out to be unpleasant. Either damaged during shipping, or dead upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: PRETTY BUT POINTLESS
Reviews.Author: Roy Clark "rclarknv"
Reviews.Content: Do you have a peephole in yourdoor to check out visitors?The kind with a wide-angle lens that lets you seewho's knocking at your door without opening the door?Well, this product replaces that simple lens for $118.78and only - I'm guessing - a few hours of installation time.For that time and money you get an added step of an electronicinterface.But the peep is  only for seconds,after you push the activation button.You could keep pushing the button,of course.The 'camera' is connected to the viewer screen whichattaches to the door. The wire is very, very short.This could have been a worth-while idea if the wire wasa lot longer or a transmitter would send the peeped imageto another room. But this is just a peep into the peep hole.Bizarre, kinda silly redundancy, methinks.There may be an advantage of the visitor/delivery mannot seeing your shadow in the peephole from his side.But, really, you could always have the lights out insideto accomplish that anonymity. Or a shroud around your sideof the peephole.  You'd save a lot of money and time too.(Oh, this viewer requires batteries, so add replacement costto your investment (batteries are initially included though).And then the view screen is stuck to the door with an adhesivepad. To replace batteries you'd have to unstick the screen. Howlong before that adhesive fails?Then too, WHAT IF SOMEBODY SLAMS THE DOOR HARD?When three-D movies came out - you know, with those dark glasses -on leaving the theater I joked that with these glasses I could seeeverything - yes even reality - in three-dimensions. Get the joke?Well, this superfluous product gets the same laugh. And onestar from this value-driven/More is Less consumer joker.
